verse: The leaders of ·Gilead’s family group [the clan of the sons/descendants of Gilead] went to talk to Moses and the leaders of the ·families [clans] of ·Israel [sons/children of Israel]. (Gilead was the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, the son of Joseph.)

They said, “The Lord commanded you, our ·master [lord], to give the land for inheritance to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] by throwing lots [perhaps the Urim and Thummim; Ex. 28:30; Lev. 8:8], and the Lord commanded you, our master [lord], to give for inheritance the land of Zelophehad, our brother, to his daughters [27:1–11].

But if his daughters marry ·men [sons] from other tribes of ·Israel [the sons/children of Israel], then ·that land will leave our family [their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our ancestors/fathers], and the people of the other tribes will get that land. So ·we will lose some of our land [part of our allotted portion will be lost].

When the time of Jubilee [every fiftieth year; Lev. 25:8–55] comes for the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], their land will go to the tribes of the people they marry; ·their land will be taken away from us, the land we received from our fathers [the inheritance of the tribe of our ancestors/fathers will be deprived of inheritance].”
Then Moses gave the ·Israelites [the sons/children of Israel] this command from the Lord: “These men from the ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Joseph are right.
This is the Lord’s command to Zelophehad’s daughters: You may marry anyone you wish, as long as the person is from ·your [a clan of your] own tribe.

In this way the ·Israelites’ land [inheritance of the sons/children of Israel] will not pass from tribe to tribe, and each ·Israelite [son/child of Israel] will keep the land in the tribe that belonged to his ·ancestors [fathers].

A woman who inherits her father’s land may marry, but she must marry someone from ·her own [a clan of her own] tribe. In this way every ·Israelite [son/child of Israel] will keep the land that belonged to his ·ancestors [fathers].
The ·land [inheritance] must not pass from tribe to tribe, and each ·Israelite tribe [tribe of the sons/children of Israel] will keep the land it ·received [inherited] from its ·ancestors [fathers].”
Zelophehad’s daughters obeyed the Lord’s command to Moses.
So Zelophehad’s daughters—Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah—married ·their cousins, their father’s relatives [sons of their father’s brothers].
Their husbands were from the ·tribe of [clan of the sons of] Manasseh son of Joseph, so their ·land [inheritance] stayed in their father’s ·family group [clan] and tribe.
These were the laws and commands that the Lord gave to the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] through Moses on the plains of Moab by the Jordan River, across from Jericho.
